intro: Oreobroma congdonii, commonly known as the Congdon's mountainstar, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Appalachian Mountains. It is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a lush green backdrop to its vibrant blooms. Oreobroma congdonii is a rare species, often found in specific microhabitats within its limited geographic range.
